clinical_study.brief_title: Weight Loss Following Gastric Bypass Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Profiling for Successful Weight Loss After Gastric Bypass Surgery

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: Danish National Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

brief_summary.textblock: The overall aim is to study the multiple factors determining the variation of weight loss after Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass surgery (RYGB). The specific aims are to evaluate a) what explains the large individual differences in weight loss seen after RYGB surgery, b) if it is possible pre-operatively to identify which patients will not obtain beneficial effects of bariatric surgery in relation to weight loss and quality of life and c) if patients in need of improved care can be identified pre- and/or early post-operatively.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients approved for bariatric surgery at Bariatric Clinic, Køge Hospital, Denmark
- fasting insulin = 17mU/L or fasting insulin > 17mU/L
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to comply with the study protocol
